FYI, claiming that underground magma is responsible for the movements of plates is rather... inaccurate. Even claiming that there's magma pretty much every everywhere beneath the crust is debatable, because areas are subject to variable degrees of partial melting and sometimes it doesn't get past the 2% threshold. So no, plates don't float on magma...

That said, this is a very interesting topic. 😊
